revised_title: Evolution of Female Preference for Old Mates: A Model of Multiple Trait Mutation-Selection Balance
tldr: The authors present a model to determine if a female preference for older mates can be justified by viability selection in mutation-selection balance alone or if biotic interactions or random environmental variations are necessary. The model, considering multiple polygenic viability-related traits, shows that choosiness will be favored with any positive mutation rate, but the advantage is slightly reduced in the case of a Red Queen type process. This result implies confidence in viability indicators as an explanation for female preferences in general.
